channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Japan Stocks Fall Sharply After Weak U.S. Jobs Data, Yen Strengthening
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average was trading down around 8% on Monday afternoon after falling 5.8% on Friday.

item.title: U.S. stock futures and crypto prices sink after a painful week on Wall Street
item.description: U.S. stock-market futures fell late Sunday, after a volatile week on Wall Street that saw the Nasdaq fall into correction territory.

item.title: Mars in Advanced Talks to Buy Cheez-It, Eggo Maker Kellanova
item.description: The deal would be one of the largest of the year and could come together imminently.

item.title: China’s Caixin PMI signals pickup in services-sector activity
item.description: A private gauge of China’s services sector signaled that activity expanded at a faster pace in July compared with a month ago, in contrast with the trend seen in official data.

item.title: Stock Funds Are Up 12.6% in 2024
item.description: It was another positive month for stock funds, but bond funds are drawing big-time cash. Also: A flashback to the 20th anniversary of the Google IPO.

item.title: Stock-market investors went from cheering a ‘Goldilocks’ economy to fearing recession. Here’s what’s next.
item.description: Stock-market investors have spent most of 2024 celebrating a ”Goldilocks” economy running neither too hot nor too cold. A run of weak U.S. economic data to begin August is now stoking fears that the bears have come home.

item.title: In Investing, Does It Pay to Follow the Money?
item.description: Fund investors can gain an edge by following net buying and selling in a given month, but such data lose their predictive value the next month, this professor writes.

item.title: Corporate profit growth is on pace for its best quarter since just before 2022’s inflation spell
item.description: After last week’s quarterly-results megastorm, second-quarter earnings season is roughly three-quarters of the way through.

item.title: 2024's Most Popular Trades Are Unraveling
item.description: Some on Wall Street worry the Fed waited too long to cut rates.

item.title: A viral chart suggests a recession is coming after the Fed cuts interest rates — but don’t panic yet
item.description: A viral chart made the rounds on social media showing the correlation to recessions and peak interest rates.
